name: Hyatt Morristown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have to say its been a while since I stayed at a Hyatt, this reminded me why I liked them so much! The check in was smooth and quick, the lobby was pretty crowded, think they had a wedding going on. Our room was upgraded to a suite, which was clean, great bathrooms! The Hotel seems to have been renovated recently. We stayed there one night only since we were attending a wedding ourselves nearby. When we got back early the next morning, the valet was right there...pretty amazing. Check out next morning was smooth and actually very friendly. All in all, we will go back!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!!!

reviews.text: The hotel is always clean and the service is always above par. The location is perfect for going around in downtown Morristown. Definitely will stay there again and again!
reviews.title: Luxury in Motown

reviews.text: Meh,
reviews.title: Nope sorry

reviews.text: I can't say I enjoyed this stay. Beds were ridiculously, unbelievably uncomfortable. Room service food was just nasty :-(
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel, room layout problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean though and parking is validated.
reviews.title: Nice lobby

reviews.text: The service here was fantastic, the staff were very friendly and welcoming, especially the front desk staff. Nothing seemed too much of a problem. The rooms were a bit dated, but I had come to Morristown for a conference, so the hotel did its job wonderfully. The breakfast buffet was also good. Location is great being right in the centre of the town. If you are in Morristown for business this is the place to stay. Only complaint as ever is that the internet was an extra, which in a business hotel in particular should not be the case.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for business trip

reviews.text: This is a very attractive hotel, but with issues. The hotel is very impressive at first. The common areas are very refined, attractive, and impressive. I was excited. Then, I got to my room, and the excitement died out. The room was very small for this level of hotel, however it may have been an abnormally small room for this hotel since I bid on Priceline. The room appeared very "three star" to me. It was very spartan, bare, and did not match the style of the rest of the hotel. The bathroom was small, a bit scuffed up, and seemed utilitarian. If you like rather soft mattresses, you'll love the beds here. It was my favorite hotel mattress so far. The air conditioner is a loud old style window unit, which is unacceptable at this hotel class. Service did not meet my expectation for this star level. Sadly, it turns out I had food poisoning (not from the hotel). I was awakened in the middle of the night by getting ill, and needed my bed changed. Somebody brought me sheets, but wouldn't change them. He wasn't a housekeeper. I was giving him a twenty dollar bill since it was gross, and he declined it and just gave me the sheets. I was confused. The room couldn't be cleaned/mopped until the next day...despite...the unpleasantness. While this is normal at mid-level hotels, I would a expect a 3.5-4 star hotel to have 24 hour housekeeping. The location in downtown Morristown is great, and parking in the garage is free and easy. For my priceline bid, or if the room were paid for by an employer, I'd be content to return again. However, I've seen the rates at this hotel go into the 200-300 range. While it's a beautiful looking place in a great location, I just don't think the rooms and the service are in line with that cost in the suburbs.
reviews.title: A hotel with some style in a great location, but questionable service.

reviews.text: Having stayed at the Hyatt Morristown for an intensive 5 day meeting, this stay was restful and what one would expect for a Hyatt. Comfortable rooms with an expansive king size bed, it was a welcome relief to get back to some tranquility. The bathroom was clean and well stocked daily, and a travel size tube of toothpaste...that is a nice touch...but $4 for a bottle of water...a tad high. To make you feel a home, one can use the rather large (40,000 sq ft!) gym to boot.
reviews.title: Comfort in Morristown

reviews.text: Complimentary self-park is a bonus, and valet parking is an acceptable price ($15).
reviews.title: Acceptable hotel in good location within Morristown

reviews.text: No complaints with the Hyatt. Staff was courteous and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed one night with DH and Blondie (15) after 5 dark, miserable nights cooking one pot meals on our gas stove, pouring water into the tanks to flush our toilets (electric pump doesn't work if no electricity), playing Yahtzee in front of a wood fire and sleeping in the cold. Price $125.30 plus $20 for rollaway; which suggests they were NOT taking advantage of the hard-hit Morris County powerless.
reviews.title: Power Outage respite stay

reviews.text: Bed was comfy with lots of pillows. Unusual but effective lights on either side of bed - rheostats. Clock easy to program as backup to cell phones (Blondie had to be at school half an hour away pretty early!). Bathroom very nice with the usual amenities. View a little bizarre since really all you can see is HQ Plaza and High St/Cattano Ave leading up to the Court House and Fort Nonsense behind - none of the real "town" part of town, but the window was big and the blinds worked well.
reviews.title: Excellent and well run hotel

reviews.text: Staff kind and considerate of our situation. This is essentially our home town (live elsewhere now, but grew up here and still attend church and work in Morristown) so we were pleased and feel confident that we can recommend to visitors. We are extremely grateful that they decided not to charge us for the second night when they heard our power had been restored in the morning - this is not their usual policy and it was SO nice to get a break - thanks, Hyatt!
reviews.title: Upscale glistening hotel for business or vacation

reviews.text: Quibble (only because we lost hundreds of dollars of food and have about a thousand dollars worth of tree damage): Internet access $11.95? We skipped it.
reviews.title: Big bucks and no extras

reviews.text: Didn't try room service or eat in restaurants (power outage has been expensive, so went to good ol' Friendly's for dinner), but have attended functions here and food pretty OK.
reviews.title: Warning if you are not a fan of cigarettes

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the better hotels I've stayed at in the past year and I would highly recommend it to others. One of the biggest reasons is I got an amazing deal on priceline which made this hotel more affordable than the 2 to 3 star hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, wish I could have stayed longer

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent as there are a lot of things to do in the area. I was here on business so I didn't really wander around much. During the nighttime there aren't many avaliable options for food and you have to walk 15 min to the diner to get late night eats.
reviews.title: Modern, Clean, & Great Service!

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful, very modern, and well kept. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and well mannered. The room was very luxurious, spacious, clean, modern, and has extremely comfortable beds. I did not have a chance to check out the pool or restaurant so I cannot comment on those.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and a good location too

reviews.text: Parking is free underground (needs to be validated at the front desk), but you have to pay for internet in your room which is a hassle. There is also no free wifi in the lobby.
reviews.title: Classy but confusing billing and a giant computer hacking

reviews.text: In all, my stay here was excellent. I would definitely return to this hotel if I got a similar price to what I paid for on priceline.
reviews.title: Great place if you have business in M-town

description: The Hyatt Morristown is centrally located in downtown historic Morristown. Surrounded by over 30 restaurants and shops within walking distance. Recently completed 10 million dollar renovation. We offer Hyatt Gold Pass Port points and amenities.
